title: How to Make a Rice Paratha from Leftover Rice

steps.headline: Knead the flour, water, oil and salt into a dough, make sure the consistency is harder than that of a pizza dough.
Cover and keep the dough aside.
Put in half a tablespoon of oil in a pan and heat.
steps.description: When the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds so that they crackle.

steps.headline: Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped onions and sauté till golden.
Add the chopped tomatoes and turmeric.
steps.description: Once the tomatoes are cooked and leave their juice add the rice.

steps.headline: Mix the rice in well, and ensure the rice becomes softer and mash it a bit.
Take the rice off the heat and let it cool.
Take the dough and make small balls out of it.
Flatten the balls in your hand and add the rice stuffing.
Seal in the rice stuffing almost like a dumpling.
Flatten this ball in your hand the sealed side on the top.
Flour your rolling pin and the surface you are going to roll the paratha on.
Make a sort of plus sign on the ball by gently pressing the rolling pin on the stuffed flattened dumpling.
Slowly and carefully roll out the dumpling into a round shape like a roti, ensure none of the stuffing spills out.
Heat a pan, grease the paratha on both the sides and fry it on both the sides.
Serve with yogurt and a bit of butter.

text: Knead the flour, water, oil and salt into a dough, make sure the consistency is harder than that of a pizza dough.  Cover and keep the dough aside.  Put in half a tablespoon of oil in a pan and heat. When the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds so that they crackle. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped onions and sauté till golden.  Add the chopped tomatoes and turmeric. Once the tomatoes are cooked and leave their juice add the rice. Mix the rice in well, and ensure the rice becomes softer and mash it a bit.  Take the rice off the heat and let it cool.  Take the dough and make small balls out of it.  Flatten the balls in your hand and add the rice stuffing.  Seal in the rice stuffing almost like a dumpling.  Flatten this ball in your hand the sealed side on the top.  Flour your rolling pin and the surface you are going to roll the paratha on.  Make a sort of plus sign on the ball by gently pressing the rolling pin on the stuffed flattened dumpling.  Slowly and carefully roll out the dumpling into a round shape like a roti, ensure none of the stuffing spills out.  Heat a pan, grease the paratha on both the sides and fry it on both the sides.  Serve with yogurt and a bit of butter.
